intro: Adenophora pereskiifolia f. stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bellflower, is a variant of the Adenophora genus native to East Asia. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky slopes. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. Its foliage and floral structure make it a distinctive and ornamental species in horticulture.
